oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Association between heart measurements and the prevalence of heart lesions at necropsy in feedlot cattle
oai_dc:dc.dc:creator: Long, K.
White, B.
Bortoluzzi, E.
Carpenter, L.
Mancke, M.
Schmidt, P.
Brown, R.
Jensen, M.
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Heart disease is an animal health and economic concern to feedlot cattle producers. The objective was to determine as­sociations between heart measurements and heart lesions in feedlot cattle at necropsy. We hypothesize that heart measure­ments will differ between cattle with heart lesions present dur­ing gross necropsy vs. those without.
oai_dc:dc.dc:source: American Association of Bovine Practitioners Conference Proceedings; No. 56 (2023): 2023 Annual Conference Proceedings ; 232
